topic.fullpath: Topic :: Internet :: Other file transfer protocol

name: UFTP
short_description: UFTP is an encrypted multicast file transfer program, designed to securely, reliably, and efficiently transfer files to multiple receivers simultaneously.  This is useful for distributing large files to a large number of receivers, and is especially useful for data distribution over a satellite link (with two way communication), where the inherent delay makes any TCP based communication highly inefficient.  The multicast encryption scheme is based on TLS with extensions to allow multiple receivers to share a common key.  UFTP also has the capability to communicate over disjoint networks separated by one or more firewalls (NAT traversal) and without full end-to-end multicast capability (multicast tunneling) through the use of a UFTP proxy server.  These proxies also provide scalability by aggregating responses from a group of receivers.
summary: Encrypted UDP based FTP with multicast
